clinical_study.brief_title: Web Platform to Integrate Behavioral Health
clinical_study.official_title: Web Platform to Integrate Behavioral Health

brief_summary.textblock: Under this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project, Research Topic 155, the Contractor will create an integrated multi-module system of web software tools to aid in behavioral health screening, prevention, triage, and tracking in medical, school, and mental health settings.

primary_outcome.description: Increase collaboration between Primary Care Physician and mental health series.

secondary_outcome.description: Increase identification rates of adults with depression and substance abuse problems.
Increase successful referrals to mental health services.

arm_group.description: A community-based provider, operating 32 primary care sites
For profit entity created by the Indiana Rural Health Association

Academic center that developed and deployed Attachment Based Family Therapy (ABFT) assessment, treatment, and prevention models with an interest in adolescents struggling with substance abuse, depression, trauma, and suicidality.
A primary care clinic in Baltimore that provides care services to a population in a lower socioeconomic status in downtown Baltimore.
A project provides free outpatient medical, dental, mental health, nutrition and social services for HIV positive uninsured and underinsured residents of the District of Columbia.

intervention.description: multi-module system of web software tools

study_pop.textblock: Patients that enter the health system through primary care clinics, academic medical and behavioral health centers, hospitals, or rural health clinics.
